de.mrapp.android.adapter.logging

Interface Loggable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Adapter<AdapterViewType>, ExpandableGridViewAdapter, ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ListAdapter<DataType>, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, NoChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, NoChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, RecyclerViewAdapter, SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractEnableStateListAdapter, AbstractExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateListAdapter, AbstractListAdapter, AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSelectableListAdapter, AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSortableListAdapter, ExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation, NoChoiceListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface Loggable
    Defines the interface, a class, which should allow to use logging, must implement.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LogLevel getLogLevel()
      Returns the current log level.
      void setLogLevel(LogLevel logLevel)
      Sets the log level.

    • Method Detail

      • getLogLevel

        LogLevel getLogLevel()
        Returns the current log level. Only log messages with a rank greater or equal than the rank of the currently applied log level, are written to the output.
        Returns:
        The current log level as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may either be ALL, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR or OFF

      • setLogLevel

        void setLogLevel(@NonNull
                 LogLevel logLevel)
        Sets the log level. Only log messages with a rank greater or equal than the rank of the currently applied log level, are written to the output.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - The log level, which should be set, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null
